section.title: Making generalisations
section.sectiontitle: We use it + be + adjective + infinitive to describe a general situation or experience.
section.text1a: It's normal to have lunch around twelve.
section.text2a: It's difficult for young people to find accommodation.
section.sectiontitle2: We use tend to + verb to say that something often happens or is usually true.
section.text3a: People in the country tend to be very friendly.
section.text4: in the negative, we can use don't tend to or tend not to:
section.text4a: Older people tend not to go out in large groups.

section.title: Making generalisations
section.sectiontitle: We use Most/Many/A lot of/Not many/Very few + people to make generalisations. People is a plural noun.
section.text2a: Very few people speak a foreign language.
